issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

In the Kitchen Sink custom table view example (the Facebook knock off), when you search the table view and press "Search", the return key displays the text "return" for maybe a split second. Easy to miss, but it definitely happens - I noticed it on my iPhone 3G, and it was reported by a community member as well.

{html}
fields.summary: iOS: Search bar - return button strangeness

comments.body:
{html}

This turns out to be a bug with UISearchBar -- I can recreate this with Apple's sample code. I can also see this in the iPhone's included Contacts application. Furthermore, there's no keyboard return key property to set on UISearchBar.

Not sure what the reclassify this. Leaving this open, but suggesting invalid.

{html}
